article.title: Exact determination of asymptotic CMB temperature-redshift relation

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the variable τ represent in Figure 1?
choices: A parameter related to the Ising model temperature

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the coefficient ν<sub>CMB</sub> in Equation (7)?
choices: It represents the present baseline temperature of the CMB.
It is the number of relativistic degrees of freedom at high temperatures.
It determines the high-temperature relationship between redshift and CMB temperature.
It is the critical exponent associated with the correlation length of the 3D Ising model.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does Equation (8) reveal about the value of  ν<sub>CMB</sub>?
choices: It is a function of the redshift z.
It depends on the Stefan-Boltzmann constant.
It is equal to the critical temperature of the Ising model.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the significance of the close agreement between ν<sub>CMB</sub> and ν<sub>Ising</sub>?
choices: It proves a direct link between SU(2) Yang-Mills thermodynamics and the 3D Ising model.
It suggests a possible connection between the two theories through their shared universality class.
It confirms that ν<sub>CMB</sub> is a critical exponent governing the divergence of the correlation length.
It indicates that the Ising model can be used to accurately predict cosmological observations.
